text:
Both total nonfarm payroll employment (+50,000) and the unemployment rate (4.4 percent) changed little in December. Employment continued to trend up in food services and drinking places, health care, and social assistance. Retail trade lost jobs. | | |

Real average hourly earnings for all employees were unchanged over the month in December, seasonally adjusted. Average hourly earnings increased 0.3 percent, and CPI-U increased 0.3 percent. Real average weekly earnings decreased 0.3 percent. | |

The preliminary CES benchmark revision for March 2025 total nonfarm employment was -911,000 (-0.6 percent); the preliminary revision for total private employment was -880,000 (-0.7 percent). | |

The Employment Situation for January 2026 is scheduled to be released on February 6, 2026, at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time.

Real Earnings for January 2026 is scheduled to be released on February 11, 2026, at 8:30 A.M. Eastern Time.
title: Current Employment Statistics - CES (National)
